revised_title: Spectroscopic Analysis of Urinary Pigments and Their Relationship to Blood and Bile
tldr: The author investigates the spectroscopic properties of urinary pigments, specifically normal and febrile urobilin, and their relationship to blood and bile pigments. They find that normal urobilin is indistinguishable from choletelin and can be artificially produced from bilirubin, while febrile urobilin is produced through the reduction of choletelin or normal urobilin.
